parameters.name: body

QueryRequest contains criteria used to search for checks.
Offset and limit are used for response
pagination.

schema.description: RerunRequest contains the id of the check to rerun.

check.description: Check represents a due diligence check on an individual.

Check represents a due diligence check on an individual.

WatchlistCheckedMatch.description:
Match provides the minimum common information expected from any screening
service.

checkv1Check.description: Check represents a due diligence check on an individual.

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

typesv1Check.description:
Check defines the types of checks the system understands.
These are used in setting up rules for jurisdictions and reporting entities.

v1AgentChecked.title: AgentChecked is the payload for AgentChecked events

v1CheckCredential.description: CheckCredentials is the payload for CheckCredential actions.

v1CloseCheck.description: CloseCheck is the payload for CloseCheck action.

v1CreateCheck.description: CreateCheck is the payload for CreateCheck action.

v1CreateRequest.description: CreateRequest contains information needed to create a new check.

v1CreateResponse.description: CreateResponse returns the newly created check.

v1CredentialChecked.description: CredentialChecked is the payload for CredentialChecked events.

v1DeleteResponse.description: DeleteResponse returns an empty response and can be ignored.

v1EntityDeleted.description: EntityDeleted is the payload for EntityDeleted events.

v1Failure.description: Failure is used by check result payloads to report failure.

v1GetEntitySetResponse.description:
GetEntitySetResponse returns all of the checks that have been closed for an entity. Only the most recently
checked checks of each type are returned.

v1GetResponse.description:
GetResponse returns a check based on the check id
provided in the GetRequest.

v1QueryRequest.description:
QueryRequest contains criteria used to search for checks.
Offset and limit are used for response
pagination.

v1QueryResponse.description:
QueryResponse returns a paged list of checks matching
QueryRequest criteria. Matches provides the total number of records
matching the query regardless of limit.

v1RerunResponse.description: RerunResponse is returned by the Rerun method.

v1UpdateResponse.description:
UpdateResponse returns an updated check based on the one provided
in the UpdateRequest.

v1WatchlistChecked.description: WatchlistChecked is the payload for WatchlistChecked events.
